title: EfficientPose 6D: Scalable and Efficient 6D Object Pose Estimation
author: Zixuan Fang, Thomas Pöllabauer, Tristan Wirth, Sarah Berkei, Volker Knauthe, Arjan Kuijper
relevance_why: The paper's methodology on optimizing model architectures for real-time applications could inspire approaches in audio signal processing tasks that require low-latency inference.
background: This paper explores methods to accurately estimate the 6D pose of objects using deep learning models while ensuring fast inference times, crucial in applications like robotics and augmented reality.
contribution: EfficientPose 6D introduces the Adaptive Margin-Dependent Iterative Selection (AMIS) algorithm to efficiently select architectures that balance inference time and pose estimation accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggle with the trade-off between speed and accuracy, leading to limitations in real-time scenarios.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by introducing a systematic approach to selecting models based on application-specific requirements, rather than just averaging performance metrics.

key_innovation: The AMIS algorithm allows for dynamic model selection tailored to specific time and accuracy needs, enhancing the efficiency of pose estimation systems.
real_world_impact: The proposed solutions enable faster and more efficient pose estimation in industrial automation and robotics, improving operational safety and effectiveness.
limitations: No specific limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.6D pose estimation: **6D pose estimation** refers to the precise determination of an object's position and orientation in a 3-dimensional space.
new_terms.Adaptive Margin-Dependent Iterative Sele: **Adaptive Margin-Dependent Iterative Selection (AMIS)** is an algorithm designed to iteratively choose the most suitable model architectures that strike an optimal balance between inference time and accuracy.
